title: Lewis Gregory hoping to make full international debut after batting cameo in warm-up match
text:
Lewis Gregory says he is ready to make his full international debut in Friday’s opening T20 international against New Zealand after his brutal batting cameo in Tuesday’s final warm-up match.

Gregory’s 29 from just 11 balls from No 7 was not enough to prevent Eoin Morgan’s team losing after an unbeaten 107 from Colin Munro saw a New Zealand XI chase down 189 with nine balls to spare. But it did offer a glimpse of the uncapped 27-year-old Somerset all-rounder’s potential as a “finisher” in this format and, despite shipping 27 from two overs with the ball, he feels ready to take his chance if picked for the first game in the five-match series in Christchurch.

“Yeah, I think so,” said Gregory. “There’s a few cobwebs with the ball today. I’ve not played a T20 for a while – I missed most of the T20 this year. But I 100 per cent back my ability. If I get a crack, I’ll go out there and perform.”

Coming into a white-ball set-up that is fresh from victory in this summer’s 50-over World Cup has also been instructive for Gregory.

“It’s been fantastic,” he said. “The guys who have played a lot of international cricket have been very welcoming. The guys are bouncing ideas off each other.
